00023 #ifndef _CTK_ALLOCATOR_HPP
00024 #define _CTK_ALLOCATOR_HPP
00025 
00031 #include "ctk_types.h"
00032 #include "ctk_malloc.h"
00033 #ifndef __SPU__
00034 # include "Exception.hpp"
00035 #endif
00036 
00037 #include <limits>
00038 
00039 namespace ctk {
00040 
00049 template <typename T, int _ALIGN = 128, 
00050           int __aligned_T_size = ALIGN_UP(sizeof(T), _ALIGN)>
00051 class AlignedAllocator {
00052     public:
00053         typedef size_t size_type;
00054         typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00055         typedef T* pointer;
00056         typedef const T* const_pointer;
00057         typedef T& reference;
00058         typedef const T& const_reference;
00059         typedef T value_type;
00060 
00061         template <class U> struct rebind {
00062             typedef AlignedAllocator<U> other;
00063         };
00064 
00065         // constructors
00066         AlignedAllocator() throw() { }
00067         AlignedAllocator(const AlignedAllocator&) throw() {}
00068         template <class U> AlignedAllocator(const AlignedAllocator<U>&)
00069             throw() {}
00070 
00071         // destructor
00072         ~AlignedAllocator() throw() { }
00073 
00074         // assignment
00075         template <class U>
00076         AlignedAllocator& operator=(AlignedAllocator<U> const& other){
00077                 return *this;
00078         }
00079 
00085         pointer allocate(size_type num, const void *hint = 0, bool align_each = false) {
00086             if (__builtin_expect(align_each, 0))
00087                 return (pointer)::ctk_malloc_align((num)*__aligned_T_size, _ALIGN);
00088             else
00089                 return (pointer)::ctk_malloc_align(
00090                         ALIGN_UP((num)*sizeof(T), _ALIGN), _ALIGN);
00091         }
00092 
00094         void construct(pointer p, const T& value)
00095         {
00096             new((void*)p) T(value);
00097         }
00098 
00100         void deallocate(pointer p, size_t num = 1)
00101         {
00102             if (p != NULL)
00103                 ::ctk_free_align((void*)p);
00104         }
00105 
00107         void destroy(pointer p)
00108         {
00109             p->~T();
00110         }
00111 
00112         // Returns the address
00113         pointer address(reference value) const { return &value; }
00114         const_pointer address(const_reference value) const { return &value; }
00115 
00116         // Returns the maximum number of sizes it can allocate
00117         size_type max_size() const throw()
00118         {
00119             return std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max() / sizeof(T);
00120         }
00121 };
00122 
00123 };
00124 
00125 #endif /* _CTK_ALLOCATOR_HPP */
